meanings.sent1: I saw a snook swimming gracefully in the clear water.
meanings.sent2: The snook was caught by the fisherman and released back into the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The snook seemed to wink at me as it swam by, as if it knew a secret.
meanings.sent4: The snook moved through the water like a shadow, elusive and mysterious.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the snook made it stand out among the other fish.

meanings.sent1: He tried to snook his friend by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty after snooking her brother out of his allowance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to snook the dog out of its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was known for his ability to snook unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The magician used sleight of hand to snook the audience into believing the coin disappeared.

meanings.definition: A look of disapproval or contempt.
meanings.sent1: She gave him a snook when he made a rude comment.
meanings.sent2: His snook made it clear that he was not impressed with the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The snook she received from her teacher made her realize she needed to study harder.
meanings.sent4: His snook felt like a slap in the face, even though no words were spoken.
meanings.sent5: The snook on her face could not hide the disappointment she felt.
